lines.text: Why do I get the feeling you're going to be the death of me?
Don't say that, master. You're the closest thing I have to a father.
[last lines]
I have to admit that without the clones, it would have not been a victory.
Victory? Victory you say? Master Obi-Wan, not victory. The shroud of the dark side has fallen. Begun the Clone War has.
[Anakin and Padme are about to be carted into the arena]
Don't be afraid.
I'm not afraid to die. I've been dying a little bit each day since you came back into my life.
What are you talking about?
I love you.
You love me? I thought we had decided not to fall in love. That we'd be forced to live a lie and that it would destroy our lives.
I think our lives are about to be destroyed anyway. I truly... deeply... love you and before we die I want you to know.
Attachment is forbidden. Possession is forbidden. Compassion, which I would define as unconditional love, is essential to a Jedi's life. So you might say, that we are encouraged to love.
When I got to them we got into aggressive negotiations.
Aggressive negotiations? What's that?
Ah, well, it's negotiations with a lightsaber.
You call this a diplomatic solution?
No, I call it aggressive negotiations.

We used to come here for school retreat. We would swim to that island every day. I love the water. We used to lie out on the sand and let the sun dry us and try to guess the names of the birds singing.
I don't like sand. It's coarse and rough and irritating and it gets everywhere. Not like here. Here everything is soft and smooth.

From the moment I met you, all those years ago, not a day has gone by when I haven't thought of you. And now that I'm with you again... I'm in agony. The closer I get to you, the worse it gets. The thought of not being with you- I can't breath. I'm haunted by the kiss that you should never have given me. My heart is beating... hoping that kiss will not become a scar. You are in my very soul, tormenting me... what can I do?- I will do anything you ask.
[uncomfortable pause]
... if you are suffering as much as I am, PLEASE, tell me.
[while chasing Padme's assassin, Obi-Wan and Anakin track her to a nightclub]
Why do I get the feeling you're going to be the death of me?
Don't say that Master... You're the closest thing I have to a father... I love you. I don't want to cause you pain.
Then why don't you listen to me?
I try, Master.
Can you see him?
I think he's a she... and I think she's a Changeling.
In that case be extra careful. Go and find her.
[He heads towards the bar]
Where are you going, Master?
For a drink.
[while Anakin searches the nightclub for the assassin, Obi-Wan sits down at the counter, and the dealer to his right turns to him]
You wanna buy some death-sticks?
[Obi-Wan executes the Jedi Mind Trick]
You don't want to sell me death sticks.
Ah, I don't want to sell you death sticks.
You want to go home and rethink your life.
I want to go home and rethink my life.
[Elan leaves. The assassin closes in on Obi-Wan, but just before she can shoot him, he turns around and uses his lightsaber to cut off her arm. Anakin is suddenly at Obi-Wan's side]
Easy... Jedi business. Go back to your drinks.
[With head stuck on a battle droid's body]
DIE, Jedi dogs. Oh... what did I say?
What if I told you that the Republic was now under the control of a dark lord of the Sith?
No, that's not possible. The Jedi would sense it.
The Dark Side has clouded their vision. Hundreds of senators are now under the influence of a Sith lord called Darth Sidious.
I don't believe you.

I killed them. I killed them all. They're dead... every single one of them. And not just the men. But the women... and the children, too. They're like animals, and I slaughtered them like animals! I HATE THEM!
What took you so long?
Well, you know, Master, I couldn't find a speeder that I really liked...
There he is.
...with an open cockpit and the right speed capabilities.
If you spent as much time practicing your saber techniques as you did your wit, you'd rival Master Yoda as a swordsman.
I thought I already did.
Only in your mind, my very young apprentice.
If you are suffering as much as I am, please tell me.
I can't... We can't... It's not possible.
Anything is possible, Padme, listen to me.

No you listen! We live in a real world, come back to it. You're studying to become a Jedi, I'm... I'm a senator. If you follow your thoughts through to conclusion, it will take us to a place we cannot go, regardless of the way we feel about each other.
Then you do feel something!
I will not let you give up your future for me.
You're asking me to be rational. That is something that I know I cannot do. Believe me, I wish I could just wish away my feelings, but I can't.
You're making fun of me!
Oh, no, I'd be too frightened to tease a senator!
You're not all-powerful, Ani.
Well, I should be.
Truly wonderful, the mind of a child is.
Please don't look at me like that.
Why not?
Because it makes me feel uncomfortable.
Sorry my lady.
What is it?
Pain, suffering, death I feel. Something terrible has happened. Young Skywalker is in pain. Terrible pain.
[while pursuing Count Dooku, a laserblast knocks Padme out of the gunship]
PADME!
[to pilot]
Put the ship down!
Anakin! Don't let your personal feelings get in the way!
[to pilot]
Follow that speeder.
Lower the ship!
I can't take Dooku alone! I need you! If we catch him, we can end this war right now! We have a job to do!
I don't care! Put the ship down!
You will be expelled from the Jedi order!
I CAN'T LEAVE HER!
COME TO YOUR SENSES! What do you think Padme would do were she in your position?

[pause]
She would do her duty.
[observing the battle droid assembly line]
Oh my goodness! Shut me down. Machines building machines. How perverse.
To be angry is to be human.
I'm a Jedi. I can be better than this.

[Yoda is training children to be Jedi at the Jedi Temple. Obi-Wan comes in and explains he's looking for a planet]
Mmm. Lost a planet, Master Obi-Wan has. How embarrassing. How embarrassing. Find it, we will try.

[Pointing to a spot in the star hologram]
This is where it ought to be, but it isn't. Gravity is pulling all the stars in this area inward to this spot. There should be a star here, but there isn't.
Most interesting. Gravity's silhouette remains, but the star and all its planets have disappeared. How can this be?

[One of the children raises his hand]
Because someone erased it from the archive memory.

[All of the children]
That's right! Yes! That's what happened! Someone erased it!
If the planet blew up, the gravity would go away.
Truly wonderful, the mind of a child is. Uncluttered. To the center of the pull of gravity go, and find your planet you will.
But Master Yoda, who could have erased information from the archives? That's impossible, isn't it?

[Frowning]
Much harder to answer, that question is.
One day, I will become the greatest Jedi EVER. I will even learn how to stop people from dying.
[Anakin visits Watto's place on Tatooine. The following dialogue between Anakin and Watto is in Huttese]
Chut, chut, Watto.
[Excuse me, Watto]
Ke Booda?
[What?]
Di nova, "Chut, chut."
[I said, "Excuse me."]

[turns to his pit droids]
Go ana bopa!
"Shut Down". The pit droids obey]
Ding mi chasa hopa.
"Let me help you with that". Anakin starts to fidget with a piece of equipment]
Ke booda? Yo baan pee hota. No wega mi condorta. Kin chasa du Jedi. No bata tu tu.
[What? I don't know you... What can I do for you? You look like a Jedi. Whatever it is... I didn't do it]
Mi boska di Shmi Skywalker.
[I'm looking for Shmi Skywalker]
[Watto eyes Anakin, and then Padme and starts speaking English]
Annie? Little Annie? Naaah!
[the piece of equipment Anakin has been tinkering with comes to life]
You are Annie! It is you! Ya sure sprouted! Weehoo! A Jedi! Waddya know? Hey, maybe you couldda help wit some deadbeats who owe me a lot of money...
My mother...
Oh, yeah. Shmi... she's not mine no more. I sold her.
Sold her?

Years ago. Sorry, Annie, but you know, business is business. Sold her to a moisture farmer named Lars. Least I think it was Lars. Believe it or not, I heard he freed her and married her. Can ya beat that?
Do you know where they are?
Long way from here... someplace over on the other side of Mos Eisley, I think...
I'd like to know.
Yeah... sure... absolutely. Let's go look in my records.
You're going to pay for all the Jedi that you killed today, Dooku.
We'll take him together. You go in slowly on the left...
No, I'm taking him NOW!
No Anakin, NO!
It must be difficult having sworn your life to the Jedi... not being able to visit the places you like... or do the things you like.
Or be with the people I love.
Are you allowed to love? I thought that was forbidden for a Jedi.
Ani? My goodness, you've grown.
So have you, grown more beautiful... for a senator, I mean.
Ani, you'll always be that little boy I knew on Tatooine.
Master Yoda. Do you really think it will come to war?
The dark side clouds everything. Impossible to see the future is.
Captain Typho has more than enough men downstairs. No assassin will try that way. Any activity up here?
Quiet as a tomb. I don't like just waiting here for something to happen to her.
[Obi-Wan checks a palm-sized view scanner he has pulled out of his utility belt. It views R2D2, over by the door, but no sign of Padme's bed]
What's going on?

[shrugs]
She covered the cameras. I don't think she liked me watching her.
What is she thinking?
She programmed R2 to warn us if there's an intruder.
It's not an intruder I'm worried about. There are many other ways to kill a Senator.
I know, but we also want to catch this assassin. Don't we, Master?
You're using her as bait?
It was her idea... Don't worry, no harm will come to her. I can sense everything going on in that room. Trust me.
It's too risky... besides, your senses aren't that attuned, young apprentice.
And yours are?
Possibly.
[Cuts to a shot of Zam Wesell loading a probe droid and dispatching it. When it cuts back, Anakin and Obi-Wan have moved their conversation to the balcony]
You look tired.
I don't sleep well anymore.
Because of your mother?
I don't know why I keep dreaming about her now. I haven't seen her since I was little.
Dreams pass in time.
I'd rather dream of Padmé. Just being around her again is... intoxicating.
Be mindful of your thoughts, Anakin, they betray you. You've made a commitment to the Jedi Order... a commitment not easily broken... and don't forget she's a politician. They're not to be trusted.
[the probe droid cuts a hole into Padme's window. R2 awakens, but when he sees no alarm, he shuts off]
She's not like the others in the Senate, Master.
It's been my experience that Senators are only focused on pleasing those who fund their campaigns... and they are more than willing to forget the niceties of democracy to get those funds.
Not another lecture, Master. Not on the economics of politics...
[They return to the main room]
... and besides, you're generalizing. The Chancellor doesn't appear to be corrupt.
Palpatine's a politician. I've observed that he is very clever at following the passions and prejudices of the Senators.
[R2 sounds an alarm as the poisonous Kohuns get within inches of Padme's face]
I think he is a good man. My instincts are very positive about...
[He stops]
I sense it, too.
[They move and quickly kill the Kohuns]
The council is confident in its decision, Obi-Wan.
The boy has exceptional skills.
But he still has much to learn, Master. His abilities have made him... well arrogant.
Yes. Yes. A flaw more and more common among Jedi. Too sure of themselves they are. Even the older, more experienced ones.
It doesn't have to be that way. We could keep it a secret.
We'd be living a lie. One we couldn't keep, even if we wanted to. I couldn't do that. Could you, Anakin? Could you live like that?
I was beginning to wonder if you'd got my message.
I retransmitted it to Coruscant, just as you'd requested, Master. Then we decided to come and rescue you.

[looks at his handcuffed hands]
Good job.
[R2-D2 is pulling C-3PO's head back towards his body]
This is such a drag.
[his head is placed next to his body]
I'm quite beside myself.
If you'll excuse me Master.
[Anakin jumps out of the speeder]
I hate it when he does that.
[first title cards]
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away...

There is unrest in the Galactic Senate. Several thousand solar systems have declared their intentions to leave the Republic. This separatist movement, under the leadership of the mysterious Count Dooku, has made it difficult for the limited number of Jedi Knights to maintain peace and order in the galaxy. Senator Amidala, the former Queen of Naboo, is returning to the Galactic Senate to vote on the critical issue of creating an ARMY OF THE REPUBLIC to assist the overwhelmed Jedi...

[returning Anakin's lightsaber]
This weapon is your life.
[In the speeder, while chasing the assassin]
You know I don't like it when you do that.
Sorry, master. I forgot that you don't like flying.
I don't mind flying, but what you're doing is suicide.
I'm just a simple man, trying to make my way in the universe.
We will find out who's trying to kill you, Padmé. I promise you.
I do not like this idea of hiding.
Sometimes we must do what is requested of us.
You're the closest thing I have to a father.
Then why don't you listen to me?
It is with great reluctance that I have agreed to this calling. I love democracy. I love the Republic. Once this crisis has abated, I will lay down the powers you have given me!
[Cliegg Lars is telling Anakin about what happened to Shmi]

It was just before dawn. They came out of nowhere. A hunting party of Tusken Raiders. Your mother had gone out early, like she always did, to pick mushrooms that grow on the vaporators. From the tracks, she was about halfway home when they took her. Those Tuskens walk like men, but they're vicious, mindless monsters. Thirty of us went out after her. Four of us came back. I'd be with them, only... after I lost my leg I just couldn't ride any more... until I heal. I don't want to give up on her, but she's been gone a month. There's little hope she's lasted this long.
[Anakin gets up from the table]
Where are you going?
To find my mother.
Your mother's dead, son. Accept it.
Master Kenobi, you disappoint me. Yoda holds you in such high esteem. Surely you can do better!
I'm programmed for etiquette, not destruction!
This party's over.
When I'm around you, my mind is no longer my own.
It's all Obi-Wan's fault. He's jealous. He's holding me back.
[Anakin uses his Force levitation to slice a fruit for Padme]
If Obi-Wan caught me doing that, he would be very grumpy.

[about Amidala]
Just being around her again is... intoxicating.
We'd be living a lie. I couldn't do that. Could you Ani?
All mentors have a way of seeing more of our faults than we would like. It's the only way we grow.
[to Pademe]
Oh don't worry, I've given up trying to argue with you.
[to Obi-Wan]
As you can see, my Jedi powers are far beyond yours. Now, back down.
[shoots Sith lighting at Obi-Wan who blocks it with his lightsaber]
I don't think so.
You must join me, Obi-Wan, and together we will destroy the Sith!
I will never join you.
I hope he doesn't try anything foolish.
I'd be more concerned about *her* doing something than him.
Anakin, may the force be with you.
May the force be with you, Master.
Be mindful of your thoughts Anakin. They'll betray you.
That was brave, boy, but foolish. I would have thought you'd have learned your lesson.
I'm a slow learner.
It is obvious that this contest cannot be decided by our knowledge of the Force... but by our skills with a lightsaber.
Do you like your army?
I look forward to seeing them in action.
They'll do their job well. I'll guarantee that.
Master Jedi, may I suggest the Senator be placed under the protection of your graces.
You really think that is a wise decision during these stressful times?
Chancellor, if I may comment, I do not believe...

The situation is that serious? Oh, but I do, Senator. I realize all too well that additional security might be disruptive for you, but... perhaps someone you're familiar with. An old friend, like... Master Kenobi.
Senator Amidala, your tragedy on the landing platform, terrible. Seeing you alive brings warm feelings to my heart.
But for certain, Senator, in grave danger you are.
She went into the club, master.
Patience. Use the force. Think.
Do not assume anything Obi-Wan. Clear your mind must be if you are to discover the real villains behind this plot.
You don't need guidance, Anakin. In time, you will learn to trust your feelings. Then, you will be invincible. I have said it many times, you are the most gifted Jedi I have ever met.
Thank you, Your Excellency.
I see you becoming the greatest of all the Jedi, Anakin. Even more powerful than Master Yoda.
Just relax, concentrate.
What about Padme?
She seems to be on top of things.
I wasn't strong enough to save you mom. I wasn't strong enough, but I promise I won't fail again.
I will not let this Republic, which has stood for a thousand years, be split in two. My negotiations will not fail.
If they do, you must realize there aren't enough Jedi to protect the Republic. We're keepers of the peace, not soldiers.
Brave, but, foolish, my old Jedi friend. You are impossibly outnumbered.
I don't think so.
We'll see.
I'm a Jedi.
A Jedi. Whaddya know?
May I ask why a Jedi Knight is all the way out here on Geonosis?
I'm tracking a bounty hunter named Jango Fett. Do you know him?
There are no bounty hunters here that I am aware of. The Geonosians don't trust them.
[thinking Obi-Wan's starfighter has been destroyed]
Well, we won't be seeing him again.

[laughs]
Yeah.
To the forward command center take me.
Senators. Dellow feligates...
Well that's Anakin's tracking signal, all right. But it's coming from Tatooine. What the blazes is he doing there? I told him to stay on Naboo.
And as my first act with this new authority, I will create a grand army of the Republic to counter the increasing threats of the Separatists.
Mem boshka de Shmi Skywalker.
[I'm looking for Shmi Skywalker]
Ani? Little Ani? It is you!
[first lines]
Senator, we're making our final approach into Coruscant.
Very good, Lieutenant.
Ever make your way as far into the interior as Coruscant?
Once or twice.
Recently?
Possibly.
Blind we are, of creation of this clone army we could not see.
I think it is time we inform the senate that our ability to use the force has diminished.
Only a Dark Lord of the Sith knows of our weakness. If informed the senate is, multiply our adversaries will.
Someday I will be the most powerful Jedi ever.
Always a pleasure to meet a Jedi.
Your clones are very impressive. You must be very proud.
You have made a commitment to the Jedi order, a commitment not easily broken.
Anakin, how many times have I told you to stay away from the power couplings.
Where are you going? He went that way!

Master, if we keep this chase going any longer that creep is gonna end up deep fried. And personally, I'd very much like to find out who he is, and who he's working for. This is a short cut... I think.
Well, you've lost him!
Track down this bounty hunter, you must, Obi-Wan.
Anakin, escort the Senator back to her planet of Naboo. She'll be safter there. And don't use registered transport. Travel as refugees.
Until caught this killer is, our judgment she must respect.
Anakin, don't do anything without consulting either myself or the Council.
Dangerous and disturbing this puzzle is. Only a Jedi could have erased those files. But who, and why, harder to answer. Meditate on this I will.
Bring him here. Question him we will.
This is a crisis. The Senate must vote to give the chancellor emergency powers. He can then approve the creation of an army without a vote.
But what senator would have the courage to propose such a radical amendment?
If only Senator Amidala where here.
Around the survivors a perimeter create.
If Dooku escapes, rally more systems to his cause we will.
Concentrate all your fire on the nearest starship.
The force is with us, Master Sidious.
Welcome home Lord Tyranus. You have done well.
Do you have any idea who's behind these attacks?
I've heard this lesson before.
You haven't learned anything, Anakin.
Excuse me, I'm in charge of security here, milady.
We must stop them before they're ready.
Protect the senator at all costs.
[Assassin Zam Wesell meets her employer, Jango Fett, outside in a back alley on Coruscant]
I hit the ship, but they used a decoy.
We'll have to try something more subtle this time, Zam. My client is getting impatient. Take these...
[Jango gives Zam a container of venomous Kouhons]
Be careful. They're very poisonous.
[as Zam starts to leave]
Zam, there can be no mistakes this time!
[after Obi-Wan injures Zam inside the Night Club, Anakin and Obi-Wan drag her out into the alley to interrogate her]
Do you know who it was you were trying to kill?
It was a Senator from Naboo.
And who hired you?
It was just a job.
Who hired you? Tell us.
[Zam stays silent; Anakin raises his tone with anger]
Tell us now!
It was a bounty hunter called...
[Zam is suddenly shot in the neck by a toxic dart; Anakin and Obi-Wan see a "rocket-man" take off and fly away, and Zam dies]
You'll be fine.
It's not me, M'lady. I'm worried about you. What if they realize you left the capital?

[regarding Anakin]
Well, then my Jedi protector will have to prove how good he is.
I've had the most peculiar dream.
Blast. This is why I hate flying.
She can't do that! Shoot her or something!
We live in a real world, Ani. Come back to it.
Clear your mind must be, if you are to discover the real villains behind this plot.
I've got a bad feeling about this.
Master Owen, may I present two most important visitors?
I'm Anakin Skywalker.

[intrigued, but wary, tone]
Owen Lars. This is my girlfriend, Beru.
Hello.
I'm Padme.
Well... I guess I'm your stepbrother. I had a feeling you might show up someday.
Is my mother here?
[a one-legged Cliegg Lars appears]
No, she's not. Cliegg Lars. Shmi is my wife. Come inside, we've got a lot to talk about.
[Anakin's lightsaber is broken in half]
Not again. Obi-Wan's going to kill me.
Sometimes there are things no one can fix.
He says he has a message from an Obi-Wan Kenobi, Master Anakin. Do you know what he's talking about?
[as he realizes the man he just pushed off a building is still attached to him]
Oh, not good.
They are using a bounty hunter named Jango Fett to create a clone army.
Master Windu, you have fought gallantly. Worthy of recognition in the archives of the Jedi Order. Now... it is finished.
What's all this? A battle? There must be some mistake! I'm programmed for etiquette, not destruction!
Powerful you have become Dooku, the dark side I sense in you.
I have become more powerful than any Jedi. Even you.
[Dooku shoots Sith lighting at Yoda who effortlessly deflects it away]
Much to learn, you still have.
Jedi business. Go back to your drinks.
Geonosians don't trust bounty hunters.
Well, who can blame them?
You're sweating.
For a mechanic, you seem to do an incessant amount of thinking.
I have good news for you, my lord. War has begun.
Excellent. Everything is going as planned.
You're asking me to be rational. I know that is something I cannot do.
[Padme says that she believes Count Dooku is behind the attacks on her life]
He is a political idealist, not a murderer.
You know, m'lady, that Count Dooku was once a Jedi. He couldn't assassinate anyone. It's not in his character.
I will never join you, Dooku.
It may be difficult to secure your release.
And don't forget, she's a politician, and they're *not* to be trusted.
These Kaminos, are they friendly?
That depends.
Depends on what Dex?
On how well your manners are, and how big your pocketbook is.
This baby belongs to them cloners. What you got here is a Kamino Saberdart.
I wonder why it didn't show up in the analysis archives.

It's these funny little cuts on the side that give it away. Those analysis droids only focus on symbols. Huh! I should think that you Jedi would have more respect for the difference between knowledge and... heh heh heh... wisdom.
Well if droids could think, there'd be none of us here, would there?

[points his gun at Anakin]
Don't move, Jedi. Take him away!
It's outrageous! After four trials in the Supreme Court, Nute Gunray is still the viceroy of the Trade Federation! I feel the Senate is powerless to resolve this crisis.
[Jango Fett is trying to destroy Obi-wan's ship]
Get him, Dad, get him. Fire!
Fought well you have, my old Padawan
This is just the beginnig!
If the Senate votes to create an army, I'm sure it's going to push us into a civil war.
It's unthinkable! There hasn't been a full-scale war since the formation of the Republic!
Do you seen any way to bring the Seperatists back into the Republic through negotations?
Not if they feel threatened. My guess is that they will turn to the Trade Federation or even the Commerce Guilds for help.

It's hard to belive that after four trials in the Supreme Court, Nute Gunray is still the viceroy of the Trade Federation. I feel that the senate is powerless to prevent this crisis from getting any further.

[to Anakin]
The maker has returned!
This is not looking good at all!
We must get the starships back into space!
Do you believe what Dooku said about this 'Darth Sidious' controlling the senate? It doesn't feel right.
Joined the Dark Side Dooku has. Lies, deceit, creating mistrust are his ways now.
You look tired.
I haven't had much sleep of late.
Because of your mother?
[Anakin nods]
...Dreams pass in time.
It's a great pleasure to see you again, milady.
It has been far too long, Master Kenobi. Ani? My goodness you've grown.
So have you. Grown more beautiful, I mean. Well, for a Senator I mean.
We have to keep out faith in the Republic. The day we stop believing democracy can work is the day we lose it.
Let's pray that day never comes.
We will not be hostages to be bartered, Dooku.

[Jocasta Nu asks Obi-Wan if he's having a problem]
Yes, I'm trying to find a planet system called Kamino. It doesn't seem to show upon any of the archive charts.
Kamino? It's not a system I'm familiar with. Let me see.
Are you sure you have the right co-ordinates?
According to my information, it should be in this quadrant somewhere, just south of the Rishi Maze.
No co-ordinates? It sounds like the kind of directions you'd get from a street tout, some old miner or Furbog trader.
All three actually.
Are you sure it exists?
Absolutely.
Let me do a gravitational scan.
[They study the star hologram]
There are some inconsistencies here. Maybe the planet you're looking for was destroyed.
Wouldn't that be on record?
It ought to be. Unless it was very recent.
[She shakes her head]
I hate to say it, but it looks like the system you're searching for doesn't exist.
That's impossible. Perhaps the archives are incomplete.
The archives are comprehensive and totally secure, my young Jedi. One thing you may be absolutely sure of - if an item does not appear in our records, it does not exist!
